attributes.title: Beehive Cheese
attributes.description:
Created on November 21, 2010 by JField on Sourcemap.org:

Founded in 2005 by brothers-in-law Tim Welsh and Pat Ford, Beehive Cheese Co. is an artisan creamery that ships cheese to most of the United States and to Canada.

attributes.name: Beehive Cheese
attributes.title: Beehive Cheese
attributes.description: Founded in 2005 by brothers-in-law Tim Welsh and Pat Ford, Beehive Cheese Co. is an artisan creamery that ships cheese to most of the United States and to Canada.

attributes.name: Cultures and Rennet
attributes.title: Cultures and Rennet
attributes.description: Cheese culture and rennet from Chr. Hansen.  Cheese cultures, which are specialized bacteria, and rennet are the key catalysts that turn milk into cheese.  While rennet historically comes from cow stomachs, most rennet used today is modified bacteria.  Rennet can also be derived from certain plants and fungi.

attributes.name: Salt
attributes.title: Salt
attributes.description: Salt from Redmond RealSalt.  This salt is mined from a dried-up sea bed, 200 miles south of Salt Lake City.

attributes.name: Plastic packaging
attributes.title: Plastic packaging
attributes.description: Plastic packaging from Vilutis & Co. Inc.  Plastic packaging keeps cheeses fresh during storage and shipping.

attributes.name: Milk
attributes.title: Milk
attributes.description: Milk from farmers in Willard.  Cows' milk is used as the main ingredient in most cheeses, including swiss and cheddar.
